newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Elscint says Japan approves imaging gear.
newsitem.headline: Elscint says Japan approves imaging gear.

text.p: Israel's Elscint Ltd said on Monday that the Japanese government had approved the marketing of its VariCam nuclear medical (NM) imaging system in Japan.
Elscint said in a statement that the first two Japanese orders for the medical-imaging product were expected to be completed soon. It did not name the buyers or the value of the orders.

The company has been marketing the VariCam worldwide since the second quarter of 1996 and has already supplied four systems to customers. Philips Medical Systems will market the camera under the Elscint brand name in Japan under a deal announced in September.
Elscint chief executive officer Jonathan Adereth expressed satisfaction at Japan's approval of the camera under its Pharmaceutical Affairs Law.
"The Japanese market for medical-imaging products is estimated at an annual $2.5 billion," he said in a statement.

"The agreement with Philips has strategic importance in that we have never marketed our products in Japan and we expect this cooperation will result in gaining a significant piece of this gigantic market," he said.
